meanings.definition: To make a crackling or rustling sound.
meanings.sent1: The leaves ruckle under my feet as I walk through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I heard the paper ruckle as I crumpled it into a ball.
meanings.sent3: The old book seemed to ruckle with every turn of the page.
meanings.sent4: The firewood began to ruckle in the fireplace, creating a cozy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The cereal ruckled as I poured milk over it, filling the kitchen with a comforting sound.

meanings.sent1: She smoothed out the ruckle in the tablecloth before setting the table.
meanings.sent2: The tailor carefully ironed out the ruckle in the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The map had a ruckle right in the middle, making it hard to read.
meanings.sent4: The old parchment had a deep ruckle from being folded for many years.
meanings.sent5: The bedsheet had a small ruckle near the edge, but it didn't bother her sleep.

meanings.sent1: The sudden ruckle in the classroom caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: There was a loud ruckle outside, making me curious to see what was happening.
meanings.sent3: The ruckle of the wind outside made it hard to concentrate on my book.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected ruckle in the library made everyone look up from their books.
meanings.sent5: The ruckle of the crowd at the concert added to the excitement of the event.
